title: How to Make Vanilla Pudding Shortcake

steps.headline: Pre-heat your oven to the recommended temperature on your cake mix box.
Combine the cold milk with the vanilla pudding mix in a medium sized bowl.
Mix ingredients well with a wire whisk or mixer for 2 minutes or until smooth.
Store the bowl in the refrigerator until you're ready to use it.
Mix the oil, eggs, cake mix, and cup of water in the large bowl.
steps.description: Beat mixture with a wire whisk or mixer for two minutes or thoroughly combined.

steps.headline: Place cupcake papers into a muffin tin.
steps.description: If you don't have tins, you can also prepare the papers in a casserole dish. Please see the Tips section on the result of using one. Fill each cupcake paper about 1/2 to 3/4 full. The cupcakes will expand in the oven, so do not overfill them.

steps.headline: Bake the cupcakes in the oven for the amount of time the cake mix box says.
steps.description: The average timing is between 19 to 22 minutes, but can vary on each box.

steps.headline: Remove the cupcakes from the oven and let it sit to cool.
Store the cupcakes with the wrappers in air-tight containers until you are ready to use.
Take off the paper/wrapper of one cupcake.
steps.description: Place the cupcake on a plate and cover it with a good layer of vanilla pudding.

steps.headline: Remove a wrapper from another cupcake and place that cupcake on top of the vanilla pudding.
steps.description: Scoop up another generous amount of vanilla pudding and cover the top of the cupcake.

text: Steps Pre-heat your oven to the recommended temperature on your cake mix box.  Combine the cold milk with the vanilla pudding mix in a medium sized bowl.  Mix ingredients well with a wire whisk or mixer for 2 minutes or until smooth.  Store the bowl in the refrigerator until you're ready to use it.  Mix the oil, eggs, cake mix, and cup of water in the large bowl. Beat mixture with a wire whisk or mixer for two minutes or thoroughly combined. Place cupcake papers into a muffin tin. If you don't have tins, you can also prepare the papers in a casserole dish. Please see the Tips section on the result of using one. Fill each cupcake paper about 1/2 to 3/4 full. The cupcakes will expand in the oven, so do not overfill them. Bake the cupcakes in the oven for the amount of time the cake mix box says. The average timing is between 19 to 22 minutes, but can vary on each box. Remove the cupcakes from the oven and let it sit to cool.  Store the cupcakes with the wrappers in air-tight containers until you are ready to use.  Create the Pudding Shortcake Take off the paper/wrapper of one cupcake. Place the cupcake on a plate and cover it with a good layer of vanilla pudding. Remove a wrapper from another cupcake and place that cupcake on top of the vanilla pudding. Scoop up another generous amount of vanilla pudding and cover the top of the cupcake.
